title: How to Make a Galaxy Model

steps.headline: Prepare your materials.
steps.description: You will need a black sheet of construction paper, white watercolor paint, a paint brush, silver glitter, gold glitter, silver sparkles, and light purple watercolor paint.

steps.headline: Paint a white oval with the watercolor paint.
steps.description: Set the black sheet of paper on a smooth surface. Using the paint brush, paint a medium-sized white oval using the white watercolor paint.

steps.headline: Paint white streaks over the oval.
steps.description: Using the paint brush, paint small white streaks to resemble the 'swirls' on the Milky Way. Paint them next to the oval.

steps.headline: Paint the edges of the galaxy using light purple.
steps.description: Using the paint brush, lightly paint the outline and edges of the galaxy using the light purple watercolor.

steps.headline: Use the silver glitter to outline the galaxy you've painted.
Dot the gold and silver glitter all over the paper to resemble stars.
Sprinkle the silver sparkles all over the paper.
steps.description: Gently shake off the excess glitter in a trash can.

steps.headline: Allow the model to fully dry for several hours.
Enjoy!
steps.description: Hang up your model and show off your galaxy of the Milky Way to others.

steps.headline: Prepare your materials.
steps.description: You will need a black sheet of construction paper, red paint, orange paint, silver glitter, yellow paint, a foam brush, shaved black chalk, and a paint brush.

steps.headline: Paint the paper with red paint.
steps.description: Place the black sheet of paper on a smooth surface. Using the foam brush, lather red paint over the sheet of paper. Do not thoroughly paint the piece of paper, leave some spots and spaces to resemble the darkness of the galaxy.

steps.headline: Paint the orange paint on top.
steps.description: Using the foam brush, paint the orange paint with the red, slightly mixing it and combining it to form a reddish-orange galaxy theme. Again, do not fully paint the page. Leave a few black spaces to resemble the galaxy.

steps.headline: Paint a yellow streak on the galaxy.
steps.description: Using the pain brush, use the yellow paint to paint a yellow streak to help resemble the galaxy even more. Paint it in the middle of the galaxy so it can be visible and seen easily.

steps.headline: Sprinkle the black shaved chalk all over the page.
Dot the silver glitter all over the page to resemble stars.
Allow the model to fully dry for several hours.
Enjoy!
steps.description: Hang up your model and show off your red galaxy to others.

steps.headline: Prepare your materials.
steps.description: You will need a black sheet of construction paper, dark blue paint, light blue paint, silver glitter, a foam brush, a regular paint brush, and purple sparkles.

steps.headline: Paint the paper a dark blue color.
steps.description: Lay the black sheet of paper on a smooth surface. Using the foam brush, paint the black piece of paper with dark blue paint. Don't fully cover the page, leave some of the edges alone to resemble the darkness of the galaxy more vividly.

steps.headline: Paint the swirls using light blue paint.
steps.description: Using the regular paint brush, swirl and paint the page with the light blue paint. Paint only the middle area of the page so it can resemble the galaxy more clearly.

steps.headline: Dot silver glitter all over the page to resemble stars.
Sprinkle purple sparkles all over the page.
Allow the model to fully dry for several hours.
Enjoy!
steps.description: Hang up your model and show off your blue galaxy to others.

steps.headline: Prepare your materials.
steps.description: You will need a black sheet of construction paper, dark green paint, light green watercolor paint, a foam brush, a regular paint brush, silver glitter, and purple or blue sparkles.

steps.headline: Paint the paper with the dark green paint.
steps.description: Lay the black sheet of paper on a smooth surface. Using the foam brush, paint the page a dark green color using the dark green paint. Don't fully cover the page, leave some of the edges alone to resemble the darkness of the galaxy more vividly.

steps.headline: Paint extra details with light green watercolor.
steps.description: Using the regular paint brush, add small realistic details on the galaxy using the light green watercolor paint. Try adding small swirls and curves to make the galaxy more realistic.

steps.headline: Dot silver glitter all over the page to resemble stars.
Sprinkle the sparkles all over the page.
Allow the model to fully dry for several hours.
Enjoy!
steps.description: Hang up your model and show off your green galaxy to others.

steps.headline: Prepare your materials.
steps.description: You will need dark purple paint, violet paint, light blue watercolor paint, silver glitter, a foam brush, a regular paint brush, and blue sparkles.

steps.headline: Paint the paper with the dark purple paint.
steps.description: Lay the black sheet of paper on a smooth surface. Using the foam brush, paint the page a dark green color using the dark green paint. Don't fully cover the page, leave some of the edges alone to resemble the darkness of the galaxy more vividly.

steps.headline: Paint extra details with the violet paint and watercolor.
steps.description: Using the regular paint brush, add small realistic details on the galaxy using the watercolor paint and violet paint. Try adding small swirls and curves to make the galaxy more realistic.

steps.headline: Squirt a small oval of silver glitter in the middle of the galaxy model.
Dot silver glitter all over the page to resemble stars.
Sprinkle the sparkles all over the page.
Allow the model to fully dry for several hours.
Enjoy!
steps.description: Hang up your model and show off your green galaxy to others

text: Milky Way Galaxy Model Prepare your materials. You will need a black sheet of construction paper, white watercolor paint, a paint brush, silver glitter, gold glitter, silver sparkles, and light purple watercolor paint. Paint a white oval with the watercolor paint. Set the black sheet of paper on a smooth surface. Using the paint brush, paint a medium-sized white oval using the white watercolor paint. Paint white streaks over the oval. Using the paint brush, paint small white streaks to resemble the 'swirls' on the Milky Way. Paint them next to the oval. Paint the edges of the galaxy using light purple. Using the paint brush, lightly paint the outline and edges of the galaxy using the light purple watercolor. Use the silver glitter to outline the galaxy you've painted.  Dot the gold and silver glitter all over the paper to resemble stars.  Sprinkle the silver sparkles all over the paper. Gently shake off the excess glitter in a trash can. Allow the model to fully dry for several hours.  Enjoy! Hang up your model and show off your galaxy of the Milky Way to others. Red Galaxy Model Prepare your materials. You will need a black sheet of construction paper, red paint, orange paint, silver glitter, yellow paint, a foam brush, shaved black chalk, and a paint brush. Paint the paper with red paint. Place the black sheet of paper on a smooth surface. Using the foam brush, lather red paint over the sheet of paper. Do not thoroughly paint the piece of paper, leave some spots and spaces to resemble the darkness of the galaxy. Paint the orange paint on top. Using the foam brush, paint the orange paint with the red, slightly mixing it and combining it to form a reddish-orange galaxy theme. Again, do not fully paint the page. Leave a few black spaces to resemble the galaxy. Paint a yellow streak on the galaxy. Using the pain brush, use the yellow paint to paint a yellow streak to help resemble the galaxy even more. Paint it in the middle of the galaxy so it can be visible and seen easily. Sprinkle the black shaved chalk all over the page.  Dot the silver glitter all over the page to resemble stars.  Allow the model to fully dry for several hours.  Enjoy! Hang up your model and show off your red galaxy to others. Blue Galaxy Model Prepare your materials. You will need a black sheet of construction paper, dark blue paint, light blue paint, silver glitter, a foam brush, a regular paint brush, and purple sparkles. Paint the paper a dark blue color. Lay the black sheet of paper on a smooth surface. Using the foam brush, paint the black piece of paper with dark blue paint. Don't fully cover the page, leave some of the edges alone to resemble the darkness of the galaxy more vividly. Paint the swirls using light blue paint. Using the regular paint brush, swirl and paint the page with the light blue paint. Paint only the middle area of the page so it can resemble the galaxy more clearly. Dot silver glitter all over the page to resemble stars.  Sprinkle purple sparkles all over the page.  Allow the model to fully dry for several hours.  Enjoy! Hang up your model and show off your blue galaxy to others. Green Galaxy Model Prepare your materials. You will need a black sheet of construction paper, dark green paint, light green watercolor paint, a foam brush, a regular paint brush, silver glitter, and purple or blue sparkles. Paint the paper with the dark green paint. Lay the black sheet of paper on a smooth surface. Using the foam brush, paint the page a dark green color using the dark green paint. Don't fully cover the page, leave some of the edges alone to resemble the darkness of the galaxy more vividly. Paint extra details with light green watercolor. Using the regular paint brush, add small realistic details on the galaxy using the light green watercolor paint. Try adding small swirls and curves to make the galaxy more realistic. Dot silver glitter all over the page to resemble stars.  Sprinkle the sparkles all over the page.  Allow the model to fully dry for several hours.  Enjoy! Hang up your model and show off your green galaxy to others. Purple Galaxy Model Prepare your materials. You will need dark purple paint, violet paint, light blue watercolor paint, silver glitter, a foam brush, a regular paint brush, and blue sparkles. Paint the paper with the dark purple paint. Lay the black sheet of paper on a smooth surface. Using the foam brush, paint the page a dark green color using the dark green paint. Don't fully cover the page, leave some of the edges alone to resemble the darkness of the galaxy more vividly. Paint extra details with the violet paint and watercolor. Using the regular paint brush, add small realistic details on the galaxy using the watercolor paint and violet paint. Try adding small swirls and curves to make the galaxy more realistic. Squirt a small oval of silver glitter in the middle of the galaxy model.  Dot silver glitter all over the page to resemble stars.  Sprinkle the sparkles all over the page.  Allow the model to fully dry for several hours.  Enjoy! Hang up your model and show off your green galaxy to others
sentences: Milky Way Galaxy Model Prepare your materials.
You will need a black sheet of construction paper, white watercolor paint, a paint brush, silver glitter, gold glitter, silver sparkles, and light purple watercolor paint.
Paint a white oval with the watercolor paint.
Set the black sheet of paper on a smooth surface.
Using the paint brush, paint a medium-sized white oval using the white watercolor paint.
Paint white streaks over the oval.
Using the paint brush, paint small white streaks to resemble the 'swirls' on the Milky Way.
Paint them next to the oval.
Paint the edges of the galaxy using light purple.
Using the paint brush, lightly paint the outline and edges of the galaxy using the light purple watercolor.
Use the silver glitter to outline the galaxy you've painted.
Dot the gold and silver glitter all over the paper to resemble stars.
Sprinkle the silver sparkles all over the paper.
Gently shake off the excess glitter in a trash can.
Allow the model to fully dry for several hours.
Enjoy!
Hang up your model and show off your galaxy of the Milky Way to others.
Red Galaxy Model Prepare your materials.
You will need a black sheet of construction paper, red paint, orange paint, silver glitter, yellow paint, a foam brush, shaved black chalk, and a paint brush.
Paint the paper with red paint.
Place the black sheet of paper on a smooth surface.
Using the foam brush, lather red paint over the sheet of paper.
Do not thoroughly paint the piece of paper, leave some spots and spaces to resemble the darkness of the galaxy.
Paint the orange paint on top.
Using the foam brush, paint the orange paint with the red, slightly mixing it and combining it to form a reddish-orange galaxy theme.
Again, do not fully paint the page.
Leave a few black spaces to resemble the galaxy.
Paint a yellow streak on the galaxy.
Using the pain brush, use the yellow paint to paint a yellow streak to help resemble the galaxy even more.
Paint it in the middle of the galaxy so it can be visible and seen easily.
Sprinkle the black shaved chalk all over the page.
Dot the silver glitter all over the page to resemble stars.
Allow the model to fully dry for several hours.
Enjoy!
Hang up your model and show off your red galaxy to others.
Blue Galaxy Model Prepare your materials.
You will need a black sheet of construction paper, dark blue paint, light blue paint, silver glitter, a foam brush, a regular paint brush, and purple sparkles.
Paint the paper a dark blue color.
Lay the black sheet of paper on a smooth surface.
Using the foam brush, paint the black piece of paper with dark blue paint.
Don't fully cover the page, leave some of the edges alone to resemble the darkness of the galaxy more vividly.
Paint the swirls using light blue paint.
Using the regular paint brush, swirl and paint the page with the light blue paint.
Paint only the middle area of the page so it can resemble the galaxy more clearly.
Dot silver glitter all over the page to resemble stars.
Sprinkle purple sparkles all over the page.
Allow the model to fully dry for several hours.
Enjoy!
Hang up your model and show off your blue galaxy to others.
Green Galaxy Model Prepare your materials.
You will need a black sheet of construction paper, dark green paint, light green watercolor paint, a foam brush, a regular paint brush, silver glitter, and purple or blue sparkles.
Paint the paper with the dark green paint.
Lay the black sheet of paper on a smooth surface.
Using the foam brush, paint the page a dark green color using the dark green paint.
Don't fully cover the page, leave some of the edges alone to resemble the darkness of the galaxy more vividly.
Paint extra details with light green watercolor.
Using the regular paint brush, add small realistic details on the galaxy using the light green watercolor paint.
Try adding small swirls and curves to make the galaxy more realistic.
Dot silver glitter all over the page to resemble stars.
Sprinkle the sparkles all over the page.
Allow the model to fully dry for several hours.
Enjoy!
Hang up your model and show off your green galaxy to others.
Purple Galaxy Model Prepare your materials.
You will need dark purple paint, violet paint, light blue watercolor paint, silver glitter, a foam brush, a regular paint brush, and blue sparkles.
Paint the paper with the dark purple paint.
Lay the black sheet of paper on a smooth surface.
Using the foam brush, paint the page a dark green color using the dark green paint.
Don't fully cover the page, leave some of the edges alone to resemble the darkness of the galaxy more vividly.
Paint extra details with the violet paint and watercolor.
Using the regular paint brush, add small realistic details on the galaxy using the watercolor paint and violet paint.
Try adding small swirls and curves to make the galaxy more realistic.
Squirt a small oval of silver glitter in the middle of the galaxy model.
Dot silver glitter all over the page to resemble stars.
Sprinkle the sparkles all over the page.
Allow the model to fully dry for several hours.
Enjoy!
Hang up your model and show off your green galaxy to others
